task_summary: Pick up the cube from the shelf using a robot arm; perception, approach, and grasp are guided stepwise as shown in the frames.

task_long_description.overview: The robot arm is tasked with locating and grasping a white cube placed in a cubby shelf. The workspace includes a distinct cube, shelf furniture, and an uncluttered surface. The robot's gripper is initially open and approaches the cube from the front at table level. The BT supports perception retries, careful alignment, and top-down grasp with verification before declaring success.
preconditions: Cube object present and visible on shelf
Robot arm in starting pose with open workspace
No obstructions between robot base and object
stepwise_plan: Verify object (cube) visibility and retry scan if needed
Open gripper in preparation for grasp
Move above cube with a safe vertical offset
Approach and align with precise tolerance
Verify that cube is held in the gripper
success_criteria: Cube is securely held in the gripper
No collision or object slippage is visible
No damage to object or environment during manipulation
failure_and_recovery: Gripper does not close correctly or cube is missed: retry scan or restart sequence
Object not detected: scan up to 3 times
Cube slips after grasp: recovery requires sequence restart
task_long_description.termination: Sequence completes successfully when the cube is detected in the gripper after grasp.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the cube is visible to the perception system.
Scans for the cube using a raster motion when it is not visible.
Detects and localizes the cube using the vision system.
Opens the gripper to 6cm prior to approach.
Moves the end-effector above the cube before grasping.
Computes a top-down grasp pose for the cube.
Approaches and aligns with the cube with 5mm tolerance.
Executes the grasp at the computed top-down pose.
Checks if the cube is now held in the gripper.

failure_modes: Cube not detected due to occlusion or poor lighting
Approach or alignment fails due to kinematic constraints
Grasp slips or does not complete
Cube not present at expected location
recovery_strategy: Re-scan for the cube up to 3 times if not initially visible
Restart grasp sequence if object is not found in gripper
assumptions: The cube is the small white block visible in shelf cubby in frames 0â€“8
No explicit 'pick' composite node exists; picking is decomposed to perceive, align, and grasp actions

expected_success_criteria: Cube held in the gripper at end of sequence
